question: Who administers oath of office and secrecy to the Chief Minister?
option4: Chief Justice of concerned High Court
explanation: Before the Chief Minister enters his office, the governor of the concerned state administers to him the oaths of office and secrecy. The Chief Minister swears to not to directly or indirectly communicate or reveal to any person(s) any matter that is brought under his consideration or becomes known to him as a state minister except as may be required for the due discharge of his duties as such minister.
